definition: metal in the form of a usually very flexible thread or slender rod
a thread or rod of such material

to connect (a device) to another device by using wires
to use wire to close or hold (something)
metal in the form of a thread or slender rod
a number of strands grouped together and used to send or receive electrical signals
telegram

to bind with wire
metal thread or a rod used in surgery to suture soft tissue or transfix fractured bone and in orthodontic dentistry to position teeth

The flowers were bound together with thin wire.
There was a wire sticking out of the chair.
A telephone wire had fallen on the road during the storm.
A short black wire connects the computer's monitor to its keyboard.
The undercover officer wore a wire to her meeting with the drug dealer.
The house will be wired next week.

The microphone is wired to the speaker.
You can wire the generator to a car battery.

Can you wire me $300?

definition: a piece of thin metal thread that can be bent, used for fastening things and for making particular types of objects that are strong but can bend:
(a piece of) thin metal thread with a layer of plastic around it, used for carrying electric current:
a secret recording device hidden worn by a person, especially one that is hidden in their clothes:
the wire fence around a prison or prison camp:

a 
        
         telegram
to fasten two things together using wire:
to connect a piece of electrical equipment with wires so that it will work:
to send money using an electrical communication system:
in the past, to send someone a telegram:
thin metal that can be bent, used in a stiff form in fences and in a form more easily shaped for fastening things or for carrying electric currents:
a telegram
to send a message or money by telegraph:
to connect or fasten by wire:
A person or place that is wired is secretly equipped with an electric device that records sounds such as conversations:
a piece of long thin metal that can be bent or used to hold things together:
a piece of long thin metal that can carry signals or electricity:
an electronic system for sending money from one bank account to another:
a piece of electronic equipment that someone wears so that other people can secretly listen to their conversation, especially when trying to trick someone:
if something is down to the wire, it is not clear or decided until the last possible moment:
if people get their wires crossed, they have a different understanding of the same situation:
to send money from one bank account to another using an electronic system:
in the past, to send someone a telegram (= message sent over electrical wires and printed out)
in: a wire fence
Someone had cut the phone wires.
Don't touch those wires whatever you do.
The undercover police officer was wearing a wire during the meeting.
During the war he spent three years behind the wire (= in prison).
She had her jaws wired together so that she wouldn't be able to eat.
The stereo wasn't working because it hadn't been wired up correctly.
Nearly one home in ten across the country is wired up to receive TV via cable.
The insurance company wired millions of dollars to its accounts to cover the payments.
Luckily my father wired me two hundred bucks.
Janet wired me to say she'd be here a day later than planned.
telephone wires
There was a six-foot high wire fence around the playground.
My father wired me $300.
Our building is wired for cable TV.
Wired by the FBI, he began recording meetings with Chicago officials.
Thin strands of copper wire are wrapped around the connection and soldered.
electrical/telephone wire
The wires had been cut, leaving the building in darkness.
Amounts over $1,000 can be transferred to your bank account by wire or by check.
He agreed to wear a wire to the meeting as part of the FBI investigation.
It was likely the leadership contest would go down to the wire.
Contract negotiations with two unions that represent more than 100,000 employees are expected to go right down to the wire.
We must have got our wires crossed, because I thought the meeting was next week.
The insurance company wired the payment directly to our account.

definition:
An electronic device worn on a person's body that records sounds and transmits the playback to a remote receiver. The wire is usually hidden on someone who is trying to get other people to incriminate themselves in conversation. There are usually cops listening to the receiver close by, and once they hear the incriminating evidence, they can run in and make arrests. 

Sometimes the "wire" is just a tape recorder (does not transmit).

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
A jail code for passing on a drug.
transfert money in a bank account
Single, usually cylindrical, elongated strands of drawn metal that nerds accumulate, with computer/musical/etc equipment, and exhibit in attempts to represent their level of nerdiness.
A really superly awesome band that more people need to listen to.
a concealed recording device worn by someone for listening in on a conversation
